attributes.comment:
I feel like you look at international adopting parents and figure, ?they?re
spending $35,000 on various fees, what would another $300 be to them?? The fact
is that many of the U.S's prospective adopting parents put their lives on hold
for many, many months, sometimes even years, to bring home their children. Most
of those parents wipe themselves financially dry attempting to afford the
already steep fees associated with international adoption. Increasing those
fees paid to this agency will only do more to support the belief that
international adoption is unattainable for the average family. There is no
conceivable reason for these fees to be raised in such a manner. Unless you're
willing to offer a I-600a that does not expire in 18months, or finger-prints
that do not need to be retaken after 15months, along with these fees, this is an
sad excuse to exploit adopting families.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Nicole S. Campbell-Robinson
